articles.description: All the latest football news as the England squad gathers at St. George's Park for the first time under Lee Carsley plus build-up to the Women's Champions League.
articles.title: Football news LIVE: Carsley to welcome England squad & Ten Hag has Man Utd backing

articles.description: Live text coverage of Naoya Inoue versus TJ Doheny for the undisputed super-bantamweight world championship at the Ariake Arena in Tokyo
articles.title: Naoya Inoue vs TJ Doheny LIVE: Boxing fight time & text commentary

articles.description: Britain's Jack Draper - Vogue model, Oasis fan and now Grand Slam quarter-finalist - shows the future is bright in the first major since Andy Murray's retirement.
articles.title: US Open 2024: Jack Draper running with baton passed by Andy Murray in New York

articles.description: Bangladesh hold their nerve in a tricky run-chase to beat Pakistan in the second Test and complete a first series win over the hosts.
articles.title: Bangladesh from 26-6 in first innings to beat Pakistan in Rawalpindi and seal series win

articles.description: Striker Che Adams withdraws from the Scotland squad for Nations League games against Poland and Portugal but Rangers midfielder Connor Barron has been given a first call up.
articles.title: Scotland: Striker Che Adams pulls out of squad for Nations League

articles.description: A world champion cyclist has swapped the velodrome for the cramped deck of the fastest yacht in the world. Why?
articles.title: America's Cup: Saddling up on the high seas - the life of a cyclor

articles.description: Sunday saw four different events of varying monetary value conclude, but each demonstrated the joy of emerging victorious from the heat of competition, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: Tour Championship, Curtis Cup, British Masters and Women's Irish Open show money doesn't buy glory

articles.description: Luis Suarez will make his 143rd and final appearance for Uruguay against Paraguay on Saturday.
articles.title: Luis Suarez: Uruguay striker announces international retirement

articles.description: Aryna Sabalenka says she "just does not want to leave early" as she bids to reach a fourth successive US Open semi-final.
articles.title: US Open 2024: Aryna Sabalenka bids for fourth successive New York semi-final against Zheng Qinwen

articles.description: The 33-year-old distance runner is currently receiving treatment for 75% burns, police say.
articles.title: Rebecca Cheptegei: Ugandan athlete in hospital after Kenya petrol attack
